title: How to Get Skinny Thighs from Swimming

steps.title: Target your legs.
steps.content: Target your legs. This move is perfect for beginners in the pool. It requires no previous swimming experience and can be done in a shallow pool. The leg sweep targets your legs and helps you burn the unwanted fat in your thighs.

steps.title: Stand next to the edge of the pool.
steps.content: Stand next to the edge of the pool. You want to be up to your chest in water. Face sideways to the edge of the pool and grab the pool’s edge with your hand. Raise your other hand above your head. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Sweep your leg.
steps.content: Sweep your leg. Sweep the leg furthest away from the pool wall forwards—up to belly height. Keep your leg straight the entire time, engaging your thigh muscles. From here, sweep your leg back behind you, squeezing your glutes. Repeat and continue for 30 seconds. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Switch legs.
steps.content: Switch legs. Turn around so that leg you just used for the leg sweep is next to the pool wall. Repeat the sweep for 30 seconds with your opposite leg. Take a 30 second break after you’ve used both legs. Repeat this cycle 10-12 times. Contract your core to help you burn more calories. Try using fast-paced music to help you stay upbeat and prevent you from slowing down.

steps.title: Work your legs and abs.
steps.content: Work your legs and abs. This move is a great leg exercise to help you get skinnier thighs. As an added bonus, your core muscles will stay engaged the entire time, helping you burn fat. Even if you aren’t the best swimmer, the wave maker is an easy exercise.

steps.title: Face the pool wall and stabilize yourself.
steps.content: Face the pool wall and stabilize yourself. Walk to water that is chest-deep. Grab onto the edge of the pool deck with your left hand. Place your right hand firmly against the wall just below the water line for stability. Face the fingers of your right hand down to help stabilize yourself. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Extend your legs behind you.
steps.content: Extend your legs behind you. Holding onto the wall for stability, extend your legs behind you to the water level. Keep your feet and knees together. Engage your abs when you lift your legs to this position.

steps.title: Kick like a dolphin.
steps.content: Kick like a dolphin. Initiate the motion with your abs and hips and transfer it through your thighs and knees. Point your toes to help kick as hard as you can. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Continue for 30 second intervals.
steps.content: Continue for 30 second intervals. Kick for 30 seconds and take a 30 second break. Repeat as long as you can. If you need to rest for 45 seconds for the last few rounds, do so. Also, if you need to switch positions of your hands, feel free to do it during your rest time. [5] X Research source If you can’t make it the full 30 seconds, separate your legs. These kicks are an easier moderation and will help you reach the full time.

steps.title: Start with realistic expectations.
steps.content: Start with realistic expectations. Swimming helps you lose weight because it is great cardio that helps you burn calories—which, in turn, burns fat. [6] X Expert Source Kyle Kenny Master Trainer & Certified Personal Trainer Expert Interview. 2 November 2021. When you first start swimming with the hopes of getting skinnier thighs, you need to be realistic about your swimming level. It is very, very hard to jump in a pool and swim laps for 30 straight minutes. Your lungs and muscles have to adjust before you can perform at that kind of level. [7] X Research source Reader Poll: We asked 157 wikiHow readers if they found cardio effective for losing weight, and 73% of them said yes. [Take Poll]

steps.title: Use starter workouts.
steps.content: Use starter workouts. To begin your workout regimen, start by swimming four lengths of the pool at an easy effort. Stop at the ends of the pool to catch your breath if you need to. After your four lengths, rest for 30 seconds. Repeat 5-10 times. Try doing this 3 times a week to build up your swimming muscles.

steps.title: Attempt different strokes.
steps.content: Attempt different strokes. Not only will this help you burn more calories, which will make you skinnier, but, it will also keep you entertained. Doing the same motion for 30 minutes, 3 times a week will get very mundane. Keep yourself looking forward to working out by switching up the strokes. [8] X Expert Source Kyle Kenny Master Trainer & Certified Personal Trainer Expert Interview. 2 November 2021. Freestyle is great because it’s easy to learn and burns a ton of calories. [9] X Research source The backstroke, with your eyes looking straight up, will help improve your posture. The breaststroke engages your hip and inner-thigh muscles. These are often missed in other workouts and will help you get the most out of your swim.
